Document.Focus: Cerebral autosomal recessive arteriopathy with subcortical infarcts and leukoencephalopathy

Synonyms.Synonym: Cerebrovascular disease with thin skin, alopecia, and disc disease

QAPair.Question: What is (are) Cerebral autosomal recessive arteriopathy with subcortical infarcts and leukoencephalopathy ?
QAPair.Answer: Cerebral autosomal recessive arteriopathy with subcortical infarcts and leukoencephalopathy, commonly known as CARASIL, is an inherited condition that causes stroke and other impairments. This progressive condition is characterized by muscle stiffness, mood and personality changes, dementia, memory loss, alopecia of the scalp, and attacks of low back pain. CARASIL is caused by mutations in the HTRA1 gene. It is inherited in an autosomal recessive pattern.
